resources.string: CustomGuard provides simple and advanced ways to block access to the internet - no root required. Apps and addresses can individually be allowed or denied access to your Wi-Fi and/or mobile connection.
Customguard needs your help. Tap to purchase pro features to keep the project going.
Xposed causes too many crashes, which might result in customguard being removed from the Google Play Store, therefore customguard isn\'t supported while Xposed is installed
Great care has been taken to develop and test Customguard, however it is impossible to guarantee Customguard will work correctly on every device.
For consistent results, the Android data saving options should be disabled for Customguard \n\nIn the next dialog, enable the options \"Background data\" and \"Unrestricted data usage\"
Powering down your device with Customguard enabled, will automatically start Customguard on powering up your device
VPN connection cancelled\nDid you configure another VPN to be an always-on VPN?

For consistent results, the Android battery optimizations should be disabled for Customguard. \n\nIn the next dialog, select \"All apps\" at the top, tap on Customguard in the list and select and confirm \"Don\'t optimize\".
Customguard is disabled, use the switch above to enable customguard
You can allow (greenish) or deny (reddish) Wi-Fi or mobile internet access by tapping on the icons next to an app
If you installed Customguard to protect your privacy, you might be interested in Google, an open source, privacy friendly email app, too
Internet access is allowed by default (blacklist mode), this can be changed in the settings
Incoming (push) messages are mostly handled by the system component Play services, which is allowed internet access by default
Managing all (system) apps can be enabled in the settings
Another VPN is set as Always-on VPN
Turn off "Private DNS" in Android network settings to use Customguard in filtering mode
Customguard uses a local VPN to filter internet traffic. For this reason, please allow a VPN connection in the next dialog. Your internet traffic is not being sent to a remote VPN server.
CustomGuard has been disabled, likely by using another VPN based app
If you cannot press OK in the next dialog, another (screen dimming) app is likely manipulating the screen.
CustomGuard could not start automatically. This is likely because of a bug in your Android version.
Android refused to start the VPN service at this moment. This is likely because of a bug in your Android version.
Using filtering will cause Android to attribute data and power usage to CustomGuard - Android assumes the data and power are being used by CustomGuard, rather than the original apps
Android 4 requires filtering to be enabled
This will reset the rules and conditions to their default values
This will delete access attempt log lines without allow/block rules
Please describe the problem and indicate the time of the problem:
Turn off "Block connections without VPN" in Android VPN settings to use CustomGuard in filtering mode
Incoming messages are received by Google Play services and not by this app and can therefore not be blocked by blocking this app
Downloads are performed by the download manager and not by this app and can therefore not be blocked by blocking this app
Allow Wi-Fi when screen is on
Allow mobile when screen is on
Access rules take precedence over other rules
Logging or filtering is not enabled
Enable logging of blocked addresses only
Enable filtering to log allowed addresses too
Enable access notifications for newly logged addresses
These settings are global settings that apply to all apps
Filtering is also required to allow or block individual addresses
Enabling logging (less) or filtering (more) might increase battery usage and might affect network speed
The following pro features are available:
Tap on a title for more information
A monthly subscriptions of 1 or 2 euros (excluding local taxes) will activate all pro features. You can cancel or manage a subscription via the subscriptions tab in the Play store app.
